newsitem.title: USA: EqualNet to combine with Cherry Comms.
newsitem.headline: EqualNet to combine with Cherry Comms.

text.p: EqualNet Holding Corp said Wednesday it had entered into a letter of intent to merge with Cherry Communications Inc, a privately-held, switch-based long distance provider.
Under the terms of an eventual agreement, Cherry shareholders would own about 91 percent of the combined company, while EqualNet holders would have the remaining nine percent.
EqualNet, a telecommunications company offering discounted long-distance services, said it still had to negotiate a definitive agreement with Cherry.
It said it expected to complete a deal in the fourth quarter.
The new company would be called Cherry Holding Corp, it added.
EqualNet serves small business customers, while Cherry serves wholesale and commercial customers.
The Nasdaq halted trading in EqualNet's stock in light of the news with the last sale at 2-1/4.
